As the drought continued and everyone worked on finding a solution, the ocean started to recede and disappear from view.
Everyone was surprised to see the water evaporating from the sea and one day, the ocean had completely dried up.
The villagers were shocked and had to find a new source of water. At first, they looked for rain to fall, but none of them were successful.
As the days went by, the villagers learnt to survive using other means and discovered methods to harvest rainwater, rain, and snow.
The villagers also began to appreciate the value of water more and were determined to conserve it for the future generations.
